title: 5 Ways to Convert Text Documents to the PDF Format

steps.title: Open Adobe Acrobat's Convert to PDF page in your web browser.
steps.content: Open Adobe Acrobat's Convert to PDF page in your web browser. You can use Safari, Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Mozilla Firefox, or another browser. [1] X Research source If you installed Adobe Acrobat on your computer, you can launch the program and select the Convert To PDF tool. If you have more than one text file you need to convert and download, you'll need to sign up for an account and activate Adobe Acrobat services. You can also use Adobe Acrobat to edit text in PDFs .

steps.title: Click Select a file.
steps.content: Click Select a file . A new window will open.

steps.title: Select your text file and click Open.
steps.content: Select your text file and click Open . Acrobat will begin to convert your file. You can also drag-and-drop your file from your desktop into the field. When Acrobat is finished converting, you'll see Your PDF is ready above a blue Download button.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . This will download your new PDF to your computer. You can find your new PDF in your computer's default save location. This is usually the Downloads folder. You can choose to sign in or create an account to save your file to Acrobat. Otherwise, the file will be deleted from the servers. You are allowed to use this method once without signing in. [2] X Research source Once signed in, you're able to use this free method twice every 30 days. If you need to use this tool more frequently, you'll need to upgrade to a paid account.

steps.title: Open your text file in Notepad.
steps.content: Open your text file in Notepad . This is the default text editor for .TXT files on Windows. You can easily save plain text files as PDFs in Notepad by exporting them to a virtual "printer."

steps.title: Click File in the top menu.
steps.content: Click File in the top menu. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Print….
steps.content: Click Print… . A print window will open.

steps.title: Select Microsoft Print to PDF.
steps.content: Select Microsoft Print to PDF . This should be next to any printers you have connected to your device.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print .

steps.title: Input a name for your file.
steps.content: Input a name for your file. You can also select a location to save your file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your text file will be saved as a PDF in the specified location.

steps.title: Open your text file on TextEdit.
steps.content: Open your text file on TextEdit. This is the default text editor for .TXT files on Mac , and you can use it to save plain text files in the PDF format. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click File in the top menu.
steps.content: Click File in the top menu. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Export As PDF.
steps.content: Click Export As PDF .

steps.title: Input a name for your file.
steps.content: Input a name for your file.

steps.title: Choose a location to save your file.
steps.content: Choose a location to save your file. You can choose to save the file to your desktop for quick access.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your text will be saved as a PDF in the specified location.

steps.title: Open Google Docs on your web browser.
steps.content: Open Google Docs on your web browser. You must have a Google account to use Google Docs. If you aren't logged in already, follow the on-screen instructions to do so now. If needed, you can create a Google account . Use this method if you have plain text you want to convert into a PDF file.

steps.title: Click Blank to open a new document.
steps.content: Click Blank to open a new document. This will be at the top of the Docs homepage, next to other templates.

steps.title: Copy and paste your text into the document.
steps.content: Copy and paste your text into the document. Make sure your text is selected. On Windows, press CTRL + C to Copy, then CTRL + V to paste into Google Docs. On Mac, press Command + C to Copy, then Command + V to paste into Google Docs.

steps.title: Click File in the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click File in the top toolbar. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Hover your cursor over Download, then click PDF Document (.pdf).
steps.content: Hover your cursor over Download , then click PDF Document (.pdf) . Google Docs will automatically download the text document as a PDF file. You can find your new PDF in your computer's default save location. This is usually the Downloads folder.

steps.title: Open a new document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a new document in Microsoft Word. If needed, you can download Microsoft Word . Use this method if you have plain text you want to convert into a PDF file.

steps.title: Copy and paste your text into the document.
steps.content: Copy and paste your text into the document. Make sure your text is selected. On Windows, press CTRL + C to Copy, then CTRL + V to paste into Microsoft Word. On Mac, press Command + C to Copy, then Command + V to paste into Microsoft Word.

steps.title: Click File in the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click File in the top toolbar. This will open a new menu.

steps.title: Click Export in the left menu.
steps.content: Click Export in the left menu. You'll be able to Create PDF/XPS Document or Change File Type .

steps.title: Select Create PDF/XPS Document.
steps.content: Select Create PDF/XPS Document .

steps.title: Click Create PDF/XPS on the right panel.
steps.content: Click Create PDF/XPS on the right panel. This will be inside a button with a PDF icon.

steps.title: Input a name for your file.
steps.content: Input a name for your file. You can also select a location to save your file.

steps.title: Click Publish.
steps.content: Click Publish . Your text file will be saved as a PDF in the specified location.
